data.text:
The Istituto Italiano di Cultura explores “Pasolini the poet” in this staged reading by renowned Canadian actor RH Thomson (Avonlea, Anne with an E) and from Italy, actor Nestor Saied who has worked with some of the most iconic figures in theatre including Robert Lepage. The reading will be preceded by a brief introduction on Pasolini by Rhodes Scholar and author of the biography Pasolini Requiem, Barth David Schwartz.

THE POETRY OF PIER PAOLO PASOLINI

Staged Reading by

RH Thomson and Nestor Saied

Wednesday, May 4 | 8:00PM EDT

Fleck Dance Theatre | Harbourfront Centre

207 Queens Quay West

Third Floor

FREE EVENT | Ticket Reservation Required

CLICK HERE TO RESERVE YOUR TICKETS

PIER PAOLO PASOLINI was a director, a writer, a playwright, an actor, a painter, an intellectual, a journalist, a philosopher, and a newspaper and magazine columnist. He was, however, first of all, a poet. Poetry is the centrepiece of Pasolini’s multi-faced art legacy. He once said, ‘I wrote poetry in the form of cinema,’ claiming that he started to write poetry at the age of seven and never stopped.

This performance aims to provide the audience with a sample of Pasolini’s gentle yet powerful poetry. Excerpts from his seminal collections, Gramsci’s Ashes and The Religion of My Time, will be recited and performed. Two actors and two languages will present the intrinsic musicality of Pasolini’s poetry in an intertwined performance of music and words.

ABOUT THE PERFORMERS

NESTOR SAIED graduated from the National Academy of Dramatic Arts Silvio d’Amico in Rome (Italy). He began his theatrical career in 1982, performing in numerous productions with some of the major Italian theatre companies in Italy and abroad. Since 2004, he has worked with the American Conservatory Theatre (ACT) in San Francisco as an associate artist. In 1986, he was appointed “Commander of Merit of the Italian Republic” by the President of the Italian Republic for his intensive dissemination of Italian culture abroad.

RH THOMSON is a Canadian television, film and stage actor. With a career spanning five decades, he remains a regular presence on Canadian film and television screens. He has received numerous awards for his contributions to the arts and war veterans. He began his career in the seventies taking part mainly in television, film and theatre roles.
